meanings.definition: To raise or bring up incorrectly or improperly.
meanings.sent1: She misraised her hand when the teacher asked for volunteers.
meanings.sent2: The farmer misraised the crops by planting them too close together.
meanings.sent3: The magician misraised the rabbit out of the hat, much to the audience's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The chef misraised the souffle, resulting in a collapsed dessert.
meanings.sent5: The parent misraising the child led to behavioral issues later on.

meanings.sent1: He misraised the cost of the project, causing budget overruns.
meanings.sent2: The student misraised the answer on the math test and got it wrong.
meanings.sent3: The weather forecaster misraised the temperature, leading to unexpected snowfall.
meanings.sent4: The architect misraised the measurements, resulting in a building that didn't fit the lot.
meanings.sent5: Misraising the distance to the destination made them arrive much later than planned.

meanings.sent1: The unclear instructions misraised more questions than answers.
meanings.sent2: His vague explanation only misraised further doubts among the team.
meanings.sent3: The comedian misraised the punchline, leaving the audience puzzled.
meanings.sent4: The misleading sign misraised travelers, leading them in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent5: Misraising the details of the event caused chaos among the attendees.
